clauses.title: Core Services
clauses.text: This Service Level Agreement applies to chatbot applications, logic, workflows, integrations, and infrastructure developed and operated by the Company, together with operational monitoring and support of those services.

clauses.title: Excluded Services
clauses.text: This Service Level Agreement does not apply to services, platforms, or systems not owned or controlled by the Company.

clauses.title: Uptime Commitment
clauses.text: The Company commits to providing 99.9 percent uptime for the Core Services measured on a monthly basis, excluding Permitted Downtime.

clauses.title: Uptime Calculation
clauses.text: Uptime is calculated as the total available minutes in a calendar month minus downtime minutes, divided by the total available minutes, multiplied by one hundred.

clauses.title: Third-Party Platforms
clauses.text: The Services rely on third-party platforms and providers including but not limited to Meta, WhatsApp, large language model providers, and client-owned platform accounts.

clauses.title: Responsibility for Third Parties
clauses.text: The Client acknowledges that it maintains a direct contractual relationship with such third-party providers and that their availability, performance, policies, limitations, outages, degradations, suspensions, or failures are outside the Companyâ€™s control and do not constitute downtime or a breach of this Service Level Agreement.

clauses.title: External Systems
clauses.text: Where the Services integrate with client-owned or third-party systems, software, databases, or application programming interfaces, such systems are referred to as External Systems.

clauses.title: No Guarantee for External Systems
clauses.text: The Company does not guarantee the availability, response time, performance, accuracy, or data integrity of External Systems, and issues arising from External Systems do not count as service downtime.

clauses.title: Data Responsibility
clauses.text: The Company is not responsible for data loss, duplication, corruption, or inconsistency caused by External Systems unless directly and solely caused by the Core Services.

clauses.title: Best Effort Integrations
clauses.text: Integrations with External Systems are provided on a best-effort basis unless expressly agreed otherwise in writing.

clauses.title: Excluded Downtime
clauses.text: Permitted Downtime includes downtime caused by third-party platforms, External Systems, client configuration errors, unauthorised changes, client-provided data or credentials, rate limiting or policy enforcement by third parties, force majeure events, scheduled maintenance, and emergency security updates.

clauses.title: Maintenance Notice
clauses.text: Planned maintenance will, where reasonably possible, be notified at least forty-eight hours in advance and will typically be scheduled outside normal business hours.

clauses.title: Maintenance Exclusion
clauses.text: Scheduled maintenance does not count as service downtime.

clauses.title: Support Scope
clauses.text: Support includes assistance with service availability issues, errors or unexpected behaviour in the Core Services, and reasonable assistance in diagnosing issues involving third-party platforms or External Systems.

clauses.title: Support Exclusions
clauses.text: Support does not include new feature development, significant functional changes, or ongoing support or maintenance of External Systems.

clauses.title: Support Hours
clauses.text: Support hours are Monday to Friday from 09:00 to 17:00 London time, excluding public holidays in England and Wales.

clauses.title: Response Time
clauses.text: The Company commits to an initial response within eight working hours of receiving a valid support request during support hours. An initial response means acknowledgment and initial assessment and does not guarantee resolution within that timeframe.

clauses.title: Third-Party Accounts
clauses.text: The Client is responsible for maintaining valid and active third-party accounts required for the Services.

clauses.title: External Systems Management
clauses.text: The Client must ensure that External Systems are properly licensed, documented, accessible, and maintained, and must notify the Company in advance of any changes that may affect the Services.

clauses.title: Exclusive Remedy
clauses.text: Service credits, if expressly agreed in writing, shall be the sole and exclusive remedy for failure to meet the uptime commitment. Unless explicitly stated, no service credits apply under this Service Level Agreement.

clauses.title: Security Measures
clauses.text: The Company will implement reasonable technical and organisational measures to protect systems under its control.

clauses.title: Third-Party Security
clauses.text: The Company is not responsible for security incidents or data loss originating from third-party platforms or External Systems.

clauses.title: Excluded Services
clauses.text: This Service Level Agreement does not apply to beta, experimental, trial, or free services, or to issues caused by misuse, abuse, or unsupported configurations.
